title: Bug in string representation of time.Time
body:
by **pkorotkov**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
The issue can be reproduced with the following code snippet: 
    t := &time.Time{Year : 2011, Month : 8, Day : 18, Hour : 0, Minute : 0, Second : 0}
    fmt.Println(t)

What is the expected output?
Thu Aug 18 00:00:00 +0000 2011

What do you see instead?
Sun Aug 18 00:00:00 +0000 2011

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
8g

Which operating system are you using?
Ubuntu Linux 11.04, x86

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
release.r59 9302
